intro: Gandasulium sumatranum, commonly known as the Sumatran gandasulium, is a tropical plant native to the island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
